intro: Modiola caroliniana var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed marsh pennywort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, thriving in marshy environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. The small white flowers bloom in clusters, contributing to its role in supporting local pollinators.
